author: Sakhalin59
title: Nuclear medicine
body: Full Body Bone Scan. Good people, good service.

author: Terrydotcom
title: All the patients seemed very at ease
body:
Everyone at Lincoln Endoscopy Unit was so kind and friendly - all the patients (myself included) seemed very at ease.  
Special mention to Student Nurse Hero, who will be an absolute asset to the NHS.

author: melonyz44
title: A positive experience at imaging appointment
body:
Accompanied my Mum to her glaucoma Imaging appointment and had such a positive experience with Sister Sarah and Technician Kerry.  
Really professional, friendly and caring towards my Mum and myself.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Tavy
title: Excellent care at the assessment unit
body:
Hi I was refered to the Surgical Assesment Unit at Stepping Hill Hospital and recieved excellent care. As I arrived a nurse took bloods immediately no waiting around to see a Dr first. I was seen quickly discharged home and a scan arranged for the following day. I then saw a Dr with rsults on the same day a Saturday. Prescribed antibiotics which the staff worked hard to get quickly. Not easy when the hospital pharmacy is closed on a Saturday. I could then go home.  
Cant praise the hospital and staff, nurses Ultrasound dept and Drs for my excellent care.

author: empathysj54
title: Post Exposure HIV concerns.
body:
During sexual intercourse with a casual partner the condom being used split. At first I wasn’t too concerned as we are both regularly tested and I was under the impression that we were each other’s only sexual partners. However when I spoke to him about this he mentioned that he MAY of had sex with other men since his last HIV testing.  
As I’ve only really had two long term partners and believe in being open and honest which people prior to sexual relationships I didn’t feel I would benefit from PrEp. Granted that it was unfortunate that the condom split but given other ongoing medical episodes worrying about potentially contracting HIV was a concern.  
Given it was the weekend I unsuccessfully tried to contact a sexual health clinic and just as I was considering A&E I rang the Open Clinic at Branston.  
Immediately the lady on reception put me at ease, as this was my first time using this NHS service she was extremely helpful, friendly and engaging.  
I then spoke to Charlotte (nurse) who explained the options available to me. Charlotte was again extremely professional, friendly and showed empathy. The challenge was that the possible medication had to be administered by a doctor and the nearest doctor was in Stafford.  
Charlotte took ownership for the situation, went above and in my opinion beyond to ensure I was being looked after. I was offered a face to face appointment on the same day.  
The level of care was more than I expected everything was fully explained and Charlotte gave sound recommendations for me to consider going forward I.e PrEp vaccination for hepatitis etc as well as going into detail about the PEP meditation I was been given. At no point did I feel uncomfortable or judged and I can only say a massive thank you to all the team.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Exellent service
body:
I have visited your Shrewsbury clinic 4 times over the last 2 years. I found appointments were prompt, the service friendly and helpful.
Staff were professional and created a relaxed atmosphere. I wish to thank them for their excellent service.

author: ShelS22
title: Visiting the minor injury unit
body: Visited the minor injury unit at Stobhill, was seen to quickly which was great. However, the staff on reception were extremely rude and treated me like I was very small. The unpleasant atmosphere within the unit caused me to have a panic attack when waiting in the waiting room. I have severe anxiety so coming into this unit was not an easy thing for me to do, the attitude of the staff didn’t help this. I understand people have a job to do but kindness costs NOTHING.

title: Brilliant staff
body: I've gotta say the whole team were brilliant from start to finish especially the doctor who see me. She was brilliant made me feel really comfortable and kept me calm

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Professional and efficient
body: Very professional and efficient, given the current challenges. Phone consultation asking all the right questions. Medication given and possible future action discussed. Results back promptly. Everyone courteous and helpful even though they must be under immense pressure. Thank you.

title: Awful place
body: Iv been with this GP for a while but tha k god iv changed. Receptionists are rude. GPS don't have a clue. Several times I was fobbed off and not to mention you can hardly get an appointment. GPS have no time for you, want you in and out. Have to ask to blood tests/treatment. My new one is amazing and couldn't be more happy to help, so I would never recommend this!!!!

title: Excellent Practce
body:
Requested appointment to see a doctor  this morning. Attended this afternoon Diagnosed and treated. Further, 2weeks previously app requested, consultation with Gp  had Diagnostic investigation included. Very satisfied with the care I received. 

The waiting  time on the phone can sometimes be a time, but is hardly inconvenient when done from home and being given an appointment the same day makes  the wait worthwhile 
An Excellent practice

title: Impossible to contact - can't see a doctor
body: On the occasional time that you actually get to see a doctor they're not bad but getting through on the phone to book an appointment is near impossible. There is a 'book an appointment' link on the website which links to PatientAccess but when you go through the hassle of registering and downloading the app it simply says that this surgery doesn't take booking online - total waste of time. As it stands I still need to see a doctor with no way of contacting them or booking an appointment.

title: Need’s a Shake up
body: Has the health centre got worse? The phone ring incessantly, at the least 30 minutes before it is answered, oh no there are no appoints today GP is very busy try tomorrow!!!! That’s a waste as you get the same answer. I have tried on the advise of the receptionist to email,  again hit and miss whether you get a reply. Then sent a letter surely someone will reply, guess what ? You are not wrong another waste of time. I decided I would try ringing later in the day thought I would try my luck, 5th in the queue I waited 30mins when receptionist answered I stated my request all I could hear was huffing and puffing whilst my request was dealt with. Happy days all sorted or so I thought, I found myself having to ring back as I could not access what I needed although I had stated the problem. Another 30 minutes later again 5th in the queue come on are they having a laugh or what I explained the problem to the same receptionist more huffing and puffing, I felt almost like I should apologise for daring to ring with a request, eventually all sorted. What on earth is happening it almost appears they don’t really want to provide a service. I feel like I should apologise for placing a review.

title: Fast and efficient
body: Visited with my daughter she was seen in triage, x-rayed, and received treatment with in 45 minutes, staff all freindly and put her at ease.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

author: SHM
title: Always happy to give help and guidance
body:
I had my little one during the first year of the pandemic. At such a scary time I was so glad that Lana was still able to help and give me support during our bf journey. She was always so happy to help and give advice/guidance. Even just having someone to have a friendly chat with when baby groups ect weren’t on due to restrictions.  
She’s helped us during cluster feeding, tongue tie as well as blocked duct episodes. She’s also been a wealth of knowledge for trying to wean him off the breast (over one year feeding).  
I've been a very lucky mum who has had the help and support of Lana during both bf journeys. I really can’t express how greatful I have been and still am to her.

title: Perfect experience
body:
Thank you so much to the staff who delivered my third and final baby via elective c-section and those who cared for us on the ward afterwards. The anaesthetic team were in particular so cheerful and reassuring throughout (I was extremely nervous beforehand!). Letting my partner and I play our own music in the operating theatre was also such a reassuring touch and made a very clinical experience that much more human.

All of my questions and concerns were promptly answered post-surgically, I was given wonderful analgesic care, and felt really wonderfully looked after with regular obs and all of my needs met. Thank you maternity team for providing such compassionate support despite being clearly so very busy, you’re all such special humans :)

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Poor service
body:
I was told by 111 to attend Salford royal as they had the expert staff in the field I needed 
After 7 hours on a corridor without being seen by anyone,
I decided to go home.
Now where do I turn for the help I need? 
I feel totally let down 
Also cost me £35 in taxis for a wasted trip.
£35 I did not have because of the nature of my injury I can’t work,
Feel like bursting into tears 
And giving up 
Thanks Salford royal !!

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Poor
body: Can never get an appointment, waited 60 mins on the phone today on hold. i’ve had a 4 year old knee injury and cannot see a doctor. they aren’t interested in seeing you really, fob you off.

title: abrupt and unhelpful
body: I recently tried to get an appointment for chest pain, was told that there were no appointments, no advice given or any concern whatsoever , for a week unable to get through , email sent but no reply

author: Weldo61.
title: My visit to accident and emergency
body: Attend A&E tonight. Cannot fault anything absolutely brilliant treatment. The A&E staff where fantastic. Special mention to Henrietta who was amazing from start to finish. The doctor who seen me was so factual and guided me in the right direction. Thanks again

title: Awful practice
body: I called earlier to speak to the GP about my mums MRI results. Called at 5:54pm I was second in the queue, this was hopeful as I know they close at 6:30. At around 6.00pm I was first in the queue I waited and waited and even thought let me wait beyond 6:30pm. No one answered I was just left waiting ! I hung up at about 6:45pm, what a disgrace I work for public service and even if our shift is over we would always clear the calls that are waiting.

title: Joke
body: After waiting 6 hours I step outside for 2 minutes , my name gets called once and I am immediately discharged , I’d rather hedge my bets

title: Severe communication problems
body:
There are no replies from the practice on here so can only hope they read and fix some of these problems because have tried everything and am at wits end. Really appreciate just how busy they are but lots of things seem to be going wrong.

For the past 10 weeks I have been chasing a cancer referral to hospital where you are meant to be seen in 2 weeks. Except for my cancer the wait list is longer just to get to the 1st appt. I managed ( with difficulty) to get the duty doctor to see me but since then the referral has gone missing, the hospital can't find trace and so the GP needs to send again.

I can't find out from the practice what has gone wrong and no matter how many times I have left messages or emailed or used that online form throughout Jan and Feb - no reply. And so far the hospital still hasn't received a referral. 

I would be normally inclined to think a large hospital had lost it but the practice can't find any trace of sending nor of my many attempts to follow up. My husband has been waiting even longer for follow up injections to do with cancer treatment that the hospital wants the GP to give but the practice says again no record of any request. I even handed in his letter to prove but nothing has moved on.
The receptionist said they haven't had a practice manager for over a year which is very concerning and maybe because it must be such a hard job. But surely there is a spreadsheet or to do list of outstanding admin jobs that need following up? These are urgent. 

We really don't know what to do next and feel quite desperate . Covid seems to have made the practice grind to a standing halt and it never got going again. It is such a shame as been there a long time but maybe it is just too big a practice with too many staff and so too much gets lost. Especially if there is no manager anymore.

author: Springjoy
title: Surgical team
body: I would like to thank the wonderful staff at the Western Trust. I had found a lump in my leg that turned out to be a tumour. I am very grateful for the wonderful and timely care which I received from staff in many departments at Altnagelvin Hospital, from the radiology staff where I got a CT scan, MRI and ultrasound guided biopsy to the surgical team and day case/theatre nurses at Omagh Hospital and Primary Care Complex. Mr Zawislak did the surgery to remove my tumour and he was very reassuring, approachable and took time to explain what the plan was and kept me up-to-date with MDM discussions etc. Thank you for the great care that I received especially as this was during the Covid-19 pandemic.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: NHSthanks
title: Care in the hospital
body:
As part of ongoing NHS Care and Support, I attended Hairmyres Hospital for a scheduled Angiogram.  
I was received into the Coronary Catheterisation Department half an hour early for a morning appointment.  
Although early, my welcome was warm, friendly and informative.  
Right up until my release I was taken care of by dedicated, professional and attentive staff. It is obvious that the prime focus of the department, as a whole, is totally on the patients in their care at all times.  
May I send special thanks to:-  
Dr Malekian and his Surgical Theatre Team  
Nurses Rhona, Liz and Sarah-Jane for their amazing pre and post procedural care ( with their totally appropriate sense of humour!! ).  
We are fortunate to have so many people in our area, dedicated to the care and support of others who urgently need assistance. Doctors and nurses in turn need to know just how much we value everything they do. I would ask everyone to remember to thank them at every opportunity - Please.

author: Windybiker
title: My treatment at Day Surgery
body:
Rotator cuff repairs. Mr Dhillon.  
Nurses Gretchen, Sara, Sharon.  
Anaesthetists, were great, can't remember their names. Physio. A Relatively small op but other attandants also involved througout. An Amazing coming together of a large team all trained and determined to make my stay as enjoyable as possible.  
Everyone was:  
Professional, very competent, caring, informative, empathetic.  
Everything a patient needs.  
Could not have asked for better care.  
Still need more treatment in aftercare but if that goes as well I will remain impressed and grateful.  
At a time when any strength, ability or personal well being one may have is of no use to you at all and you depend almost entirely on others to give you back whatever you have lost, it a sobering thought that everyone needs to experience before they can possibly understand.  
Thank you all

author: Always thankful
title: Made me feel at ease immediately
body:
Today I had an adrenal vein sampling procedure carried out by Consultant Whittaker and his team.  
I must first say that he is an absolute credit to the NHS he made me feel at ease immediately. He was very clear in explaining throughly what was to take place. He and his team were the best 10/10.

author: SD31
title: Thankful for the clinic
body: I have attended the early pregnancy clinic in ward 43 a few times over the last year. I just want to say how thankful I am that this clinic is here for us mothers in the early days of pregnancy for reassurance. I cannot put into words what Nurse Mags, ward 43’s manager and everyone else in this clinic and ward 43 has done for me. They have been absolutely amazing through the hard and good times. Nurse Mags has been an angel to me and I really can’t thank her and everyone else enough. They are all doing an amazing job.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sjw85
title: Fantastic care in the stroke ward
body:
My grandfather suffered a stroke at the start of February, he was looked after very well in the stroke unit, all staff were approachable and accommodating despite having extra patients to look after due to capacity issues.  
The ward was clean and he is continuing his recovery in a community hospital at present.

author: capricornuscf34
title: Great service
body: My father has been to the radiology department on two occasions for a CT scan and ultrasound scan he was very happy with the treatment he received, very efficient and taking on his appointment time, polite and professional staff. Explained the procedure and made him feel at ease on both occasions. He was overall very happy with his treatment.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Countofreus
title: Emergency admissions to hospital
body:
I was badly let down by our GP surgery, resulting in 2 emergency admissions to the Pilgrim. The staff, at all levels, were wonderful and progressed my case with careful thought and, although a prolonged wait at AE was uncomfortable, i clearly understood the pressure the hospital was working under. One administrative hitch which might be addressed was that, as beds were in demand, i was discharged to await an urgent procedure the following week. This resulted in the booking being cancelled as i was no longer an inpatient, notwithstanding that the matter was urgent. I waited some time for the appointment to be reinstated and was recovered under emergency before it was. The resulting condition may well have been avoided had i had the required procedure on time. The medical team, led by consultant and surgeons were outstanding though and made every effort to see that i had the care i needed.  
As i said, the staff at all levels were outstanding, compassionate and suitably attentive and should be commended.

author: Shexe69
title: Support from the centre
body:
The Staff at the Crystal Centre have provided excellent service and support when helping us care for a friend with dementia.  
Each person has been dedicated, informative and totally reliable in helping us to come to terms with the tragic onset of Alzheimer’s disease and dementia for a friend who is without immediate family.  
They are committed to giving regular contact and their meetings are productive. They always follow through with the tasks required and explain their decisions.  
I wish there was a Civic Award for them to receive.  
We have been particularly impressed with Wazheda and Nicky.

author: Spring2022
title: Contraception clinic
body: To say my care within the contraception clinic in John Mitchel Place, Newry was good is an understatement. Nurse Oonagh and her Nursing assistant Leslie were outstanding at their job on every level. I was having a marena coil removed and a new one inserted. The procedure was efficient and almost painless. I was relaxed as the ladies had made me so comfortable and welcome. I cant recommend this clinic highly enough and encourage all women both young and old to please look after this area of their health in the knowledge that they will get a kind and very discreet service.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: cruxkd39
title: Absolutely amazing treatment
body: I was admitted in the early afternoon. The treatment I received was absolutely amazing, all of the staff were very helpful and informative. I was sent for x-ray, ct scan etc., I was informed all the way through by the brilliant staff caring for me. I even got fish and chips for my dinner. I had to attend the following day and again I was talked through my new medication meticulously. Thank you to all of the great staff at Monklands University Hospital for their dedication and support. Thank goodness for the NHS 😄

author: Siobhan1992
title: She reviewed everything that was setting my son off
body: My son had many a meltdown and my health visitor Ciara came to see us and recommended Wendy the child health assistant. Wendy honestly was lovely and my sons meltdowns were over she reviewed everything that was setting him off and honestly I have a very calm son now he still has tantrums he’s 2. But I do believe without the help of Wendy that would not of been possible . I can’t thank her enough

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Weelou
title: From the minute I got in the room everything was relaxed
body:
What you would imagine to be an embarrassing long appointment, turned out to be the complete opposite,  
My nurses were Lesleyann and Joan in clinic K, wasn't really sure what would happen at the appointment but from the minute I got in the room everything was relaxed I was made aware why I was there, shown the things I would need and they were by my side the whole time, was really a woman supporting woman moment well several moments im not a quick learner 🤣but I never felt rushed , we had a laugh and I learned everything I needed to know and it didn't take long at all .they really are the right people for the job , im ready for the next step in my journey to better health . Thank you ladies

readBy.name: Office of Jenni Minto, MSP for Argyll and Bute

title: The worst experience ever
body: We arrived to emergency department by 7:00pm because my 2 weeks old babe boy had continuous diarea for few days, after taking blood test, they sent us to paediatric department where they kept us till 2am keep saying that there ulis only one doctor on whole ward... Just imagine 2 weeks old babe and we are still here awaiting to be seen by doctor. It's 2 am and keep holding us on chairs, myself and my misses haven't slept for last 20 hours...Such a shame, sometimes I'm asking myself why we are paying so many taxis as long as they've got "only one factor, per ward! I wouldn't suggest anyone to attend this department

title: Excellent, Speedy Response
body: I left an online health query via the internet just before 5pm.   Within 25 minutes the duty doctor had responded with the information and help I needed.   Really impressed.   Thank you Dorking Medical Practice one and all.

title: Great practice, very efficient
body:
I just wanted to get in touch and express how impressed I am so far with the service and staff at Hillfoot surgery. Myself and my family are relatively new patients to the practice, after being at our previous surgery in Pudsey all our lives. We never knew making doctors appointments or getting repeat prescriptions could be so straightforward!

The staff at Hillfoot are professional, helpful and kind, nothing seems to be too much trouble and they go out of their way to make things easy for us. 

Our child was recently diagnosed in November with Addison's disease, which is all very new to us. All the staff I have spoken to or attended an appointment with, have been as helpful as possible in guiding us in managing this condition.

From myself and my family, thank you so much for the care and support you have offered us.

author: Sakhalin59
title: Radiotherapy
body: Really good people work here. For first 4 week session in 2020, NHS Grampian ARI and the recent 4 weeks in 2022. Thanks

title: Day Case excellence
body:
I attended the Day Case unit for a minor procedure under general anaesthetic. From arrival to discharge all the staff were wonderful, friendly, professional and caring. The surgeon explained everything without rushing me, answering questions. The anaesthetist calmed my worries brilliantly and the staff in theatre and recovery were lovely.
Thank you so much!

author: Window
title: Today at outpatients
body: Was at the Dermatology Day Care Department at Stirling Community Hospital today and had very professional care and good customer service from ANP David and RN Ildiko - thank you

title: Excellent Care
body:
During a recent bout of sickness I was thoroughly impressed with the level of care displayed by not only the doctors but the Reception staff also. 

Reception staff asked questions, documented efficiently, were warm and friendly.

Spoke to three doctors throughout ten days who were all professional, thorough and helpful. Listened well and were great.

Both verbal and electronic communication was efficient, timely and well managed. A positive, stress free and easy experience during a time of sickness.

This surgery is an asset to the NHS and other surgeries should take note. Patient handling was done with the greatest respect!

Well done Peverell Park Surgery!

title: What an improvement
body:
I have numerous medical conditions that render me high risk and because of these would say I am in ultra regular contact with the surgery.
Over the past 2 years the practice has improved so much from pretty poor,in my opinion,to very good indeed.
Well done to the surgery/practice AND the pharmacy.

author: Hnut3r292011
title: Such a good support system
body:
Just wanted to leave a review as I have now finished my programme with the family nurse partnership.  
I have absolutely loved it, Barbara has been such a good support system for me, I have gained so much knowledge from her, I always felt calm and comfortable around her and felt like I could easily confide in her with any worries I had about myself or my son.  
My son loved her too, he was always very happy to see Barbara coming 🙂 I was reluctant to join this programme at first but I am so so glad I did, have loved my 2 years on it

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: giftge69
title: This is one amazing team of people!
body:
I cannot say enough positive praise about the assisted conception unit in Dundee. From the very first appointment all the way through our IVF journey we had an amazing experince and could not fault a thing. Every single member of staff is so kind and makes you feel at ease.  
A special mention to Jen our sedation nurse and to Nic who looked after me on egg retrieval day. Your care was amazing and made my experience so positive. Jen even gave us amazing lunch recommendations for after our appointments!  
A special mention also goes to Maureen who completed our transfer. She put me at ease through the whole procedure and it felt like such a special moment.  
This is one amazing team of people!

author: SL97
title: Nurse was very professional, kind and efficient
body:
I just wanted to write a quick compliment for the Paisley branch of the Sandyford.  
Nurse Amy was very professional, kind and efficient with removing my implant with a lovely demeanour and chat. I felt put right at ease. She is a credit to the service!  
My only issue was the appointment booking system as it took weeks for an appointment to come up, but I understand how overwhelmed the system is right now.

author: listenkx38
title: Couldn't of asked for a better experience
body:
I gave birth a week ago at Daisy Hill and was terrified, but midwifes Ruth and Rachel were more than amazing!  
I didn't know it was possible to feel so relaxed and calm during labour but they made sure that's exactly how it went. They explained everything to me and let me feel completely in control.  
I will always be grateful to them and how amazing they are! Couldn't of asked for a better experience and will continue to sing their praises to everyone expecting.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Happyvegan
title: I’m squeamish and wimpy but the nurse was fantastic
body:
I recently had a bad fall while running and injured my knee and ankle. I was signed in by a very friendly member of staff and then after a short wait of only about 15/20 minutes I was looked at in minor injuries.  
The nurse was kind and caring, as well as thorough and helpful. I was then taken through to radiology for an X-Ray, where the radiologist was professional and pleasant.  
I was then given stitches to my left knee. I’m very squeamish and wimpy but the nurse was fantastic, very reassuring and calming, explaining everything she was going to do and being extremely gentle.  
I was in and out in about an hour and half. Thank you so much.

author: Twinmam1
title: Fantastic experience due to the wonderful staff
body:
I delivered my twins in Daisy Hill Hospital & had a fantastic experience due to the wonderful staff.  
Midwives Paula, Ruth & Student Midwife Seren were absolutely fantastic & did everything they could to ensure I had the delivery I wanted. They were so caring & kind to both me and my partner & treated him like he was at a hotel.  
Consultant Katherine was absolutely fantastic with aiding my babies delivery. Thanks to them all I was able to deliver my twins exactly as I'd hoped.  
Massive thank you to everyone who had any part in the birth of our twins.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff are great, the food is excellent
body:
Before arriving into hospital, I wasn't feeling well at home. I was losing interest in having visitors as I wasn't in good form to communicate with anyone.  
My sister decided to contact my GP which led to my arrival into 3 South. I was suffering from an infection and was constantly feeling dizzy but I am definitely feeling a lot better now... hopefully I will get home next week.  
The staff are great, the food is excellent... I can't complain. I am just eager to get home.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: memberjt67
title: A smile really does go a long way
body:
After becoming quite ill and feeling sick with headaches, I came to the A&E at Daisy Hill Hospital. I was treated very well in A&E. I really felt sorry for them and the sheer amount of patients waiting that they have to look after.  
The public need their eyes opened to the state of Emergency Departments currently. The amount of patients I saw lying on trolleys in the corridors is ridiculous – I thought this really bad for elderly people.  
All the staff in the Emergency Department were absolute pets – really brilliant. One nurse in the amber section in particular was really great.  
Up on the Female Surgical Ward it has been lovely. The staff members are all brilliant. I would particularly like to mention both Maura and Fiona who have been unreal during my stay here.  
I would like to particularly say that a smile really does go a long way. One morning Maura came in all bright and cheerful with a smile on her face saying “Good Morning Ladies” and it really lifted our spirits for the rest of the day and made all of us patients on the ward closer to one another.  
The only thing I think needs improving is the visiting restrictions in place for unwell people.  
The Southern Trust must be the only hospital trust in Northern Ireland which is still restricting visiting in this massive way. Are the staff just too used to not having visitors now?  
I also feel that staff need to make patients more aware of their visiting rights and when they are allowed a visitor in, as many of us are clueless with regards to what the rules actually are.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Fioew57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Only one improvement - WiFi signage
body:
I came into the emergency department with possibly the worst flare up of my ulcerative colitis ever. I think I spent one night in the department before being moved up to the ward. All the staff in ED were amazing and very helpful.  
Since coming up to the ward I have been well looked after by all the nurses and staff members. Everyone is eager to help me out and will answer any questions I have. Having a private room definitely makes things better as I like having my own space and having my own TV is another bonus. Deirdre and Lisa up on female surgical have been especially wonderful to me.  
The only thing I think could be improved would there to be for signage regarding the hospital Wi-Fi as I only discovered this after I had used all of my 4G.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Just Scrap It
body:
Went there out of desperation with back pain that was shooting down into the legs and numbness in the thighs.

Waiting time on the screen said "7 hours". But I was so desperate, I booked myself in, and braced myself for the long wait.

After 8 or so hours, patients (who were actively enquiring) were being told the was a further delay of 3-4 hours.... Those of us who were seated placidly were just plain ignored.

I fully understand the pressures faced by The NHS. 

But this department epitomises shambolism and staff ineptitude... waiting 11 hours to be seen when the department is not busy (I have been there when it was busy - I can tell the difference) is simply not a good use of public funds.

When staff have been desensitised to a point where 11 hour waits are normalised, then it is clear there is a massive problem.

title: Efficient
body:
The nurses have been seeing me for several weeks and are friendly and caring doing their best to keep me comfortable using their ingenuity for dressings that suit me. 
The only difficulty I find is The length of time it takes to get through on the phone in the morning should I need an appointment on occasions I have tried 25 times to get through, if lucky enough to have an answer there is no appointment left or time for a phone call
I have no complaint about the staff.

title: Excellent Care
body: On arriving on both SDEC & Oakley ward I was met with pure professionalism from all the team on shift that day/evening  having been admitted with chest pains via A&E and having had a procedure during my 3 day stay nothing was to much trouble for any of the staff members and the staff were very patient and understanding.The team on shift always explained what was going on and why they were doing the tasks

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic helpful staff
body: The reception team are brilliant and helpful and the GP I spoke to was wonderful too- he took the time to explore options and covered every aspect of the issue in depth.

title: Russian Roulette
body:
I have read all of 18 feedbacks before me, before leaving mine.
Majority of them involved around the reception staff "The Gate Keepers"! 
Unfortunately, some of them take this term quite literally!!! 
Also, I concur all of the other problems that were mentioned in previous feedback, and will only add the Nurses (which there are only 2!) to the list of unhelpful people that run this establishment.

Another thing I would like to add is that there are some very professional, helpful, humane and approachable staff ( GP's, Receptionists, etc). But all of their noble attempt to help people are Trumped by the majority of their colleagues who run the place like a Prison!!!! 
I was going to name the only 2 decent receptionist + 2 Dr's, but my comments will be removed if I did so!
It seems like that "Luck" will have a bigger role in whether you get the help you need from this GP Surgery at any given time.
If you are lucky enough, you will encounter the very few GEMS of staff members who are really there to do their job and help people!

If they were worried about any backlash from the Government/ NHS, they would have addressed these issues long time ago. Or even replied to these constructive feedback and the negative experiences that their clients are subjected to, specially in their hour of need. 

I hope things change drastically and very soon for the better.

Do better!!

title: Very good care
body: I had a total hysterectomy at the woman’s centre and stayed in Wynard ward, the surgeon was very nice both before and after my operation, I received very good care

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

author: Pag666
title: Total hip replacement
body:
Had a letter on telling me I’ve to have a total hip operation in 9 days later, very last minute as I’ve not met a surgeon to go through everything so very frightening as you can imagine !! I had a telephone assessment on Monday and they said I’d need 2 more appointments before today Fridays covid test as I need to self isolate now till my op in 2 days time , I had no call back Monday Tuesday or Wednesday and trying to call and get through to someone was a nightmare on its own. I left a answer phone message and someone called back within a hour and booked me in the next day yes last minute again for bloods / ecg / weight / height / blood pressure etc!! I was very anxious as no one has gone through the operation procedure with me at all and to be honest I was ready to cancel it all but this amazing kind companionate lovely nurse made me feel more at ease and went over and above getting all the literature I needed and asked another nurse to explain a few things I needed to know ! Both nurses were shocked I’ve not been told anything about not drinking or eating the night before or anything at all really!!  
Writing this I have an anxious wait of a few more days till my op please wish me luck 🍀 as I’ve not really slept since receiving my letter! If someone could please let this lovely nurse know how special she is I would be truly grateful!  
One of life’s very few angels, I feel much better now and maybe a little crackers to say I’m looking forward to my operation and finally after over 2 years of waiting hopefully I will be pain free.

author: Sheevy08
title: Admission of my elderly mother
body:
My mother - who has Alzheimer's disease - was referred for admission with a suspected stroke by her GP following an emergency house call. The paramedic were faultless - helpful, professional, kind, caring, cheerful and very attentive. Sadly, that was where the good times ended...  
From the moment we arrived at QEH, the treatment of my mother during the admission process was disgusting. There were no trolleys available, so she was forced to sit in a wheelchair (with a suspected stroke!) in a corridor with her pyjamas and only a thin standard-issue blanket. . This would have been OK if it had only been for 30-60 minutes but four hours later, we were still stuck in a corridor with not so much as even the offer of a cup of water!  
The treatment my mum endured was not only incredibly cold and uncaring but quite simply unacceptable in this day and age. Staff seemed to be totally unaware of the fact she was even there and not one of some 60 - 80 people who passed even gave her a smile or asked how she was doing... just incredibly poor on all levels. She was then subjected to the same questions THREE times over about her health by fairly brusque and unfriendly staff who didn't tell us anything and just cast us back out in the corridor when they were done.  
By this time my mum was almost delirious and fading before my eyes. I asked one nurse if they knew where I could get a cup of tea and you would have thought I had asked for spare pair of kidneys! Very ungraciously replied that they'd get my mum a cup of tea - and when I said it was OK, and that I don't want to trouble them if they could just tell me where I can go to buy one that would be fine, they loudly and gruffly asked does she want one or not. I was appalled and several of the other patients waiting seemed to feel the same.  
At another point I asked if someone could help me take mum to the loo... a nurse came and asked if she couldn't manage herself. I replied no, as she's in her 90s with dementia and a suspected stroke. Another nurse showed up who was more helpful if rather rough and kept urging mum loudly to stand up. When I pointed out she had lost her major motor skills they tutted and then unceremoniously lifted her back into the wheelchair.  
When she finally got taken into a cubicle it was yet another waiting game until I finally asked if my mum could at least lie down now. A nurse helped me get her into bed. Mum, of course, promptly fell asleep - by this point totally exhausted and very confused.  
I have always been a huge supporter of the NHS but if this is patient care in 2022, then god help us all! This was easily the worst experience of customer care I have ever had.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: bornfree
title: Prioritising patient wellbeing
body: I was diagnosed with advanced Prostatic small cell Cancer around 5 weeks ago. It has been a very emotional time. After my first chemotherapy my temperature spiked and I ended up back in Monklands hospital. I was told my Neurophills were very low and i was at risk of further infection so needed to stay in a room on my own. Although the care staff have been fantastic I was moved from one room to another and then at 4 o'clock in the morning I was woken up to be told I was moving rooms again. I was forced to wake up and pack my room in a few minutes ready for a porter. I complained and a nurse had the decision to move me reversed, but the damage was done. Startled and wide awake. I am physically and emotionally drained by the last few weeks and i feel that the needs of the hospital were put above the needs of the patient. If this was to happen in a prison it would be seen as unacceptable. It has made me want to just throw in the towel and stop all treatment. It's very hard being away from my family when I know my time is short and it's not too much to ask to be treated with a little humanity by ward managers. I would like my case highlighted. Decision makers need to understand the impact that poor decisions can make on a patients mental and physical well-being, and sometimes the need to manage a bed is second to proper and compassionate patient care. Also and separately I am concerned that given the fact that I am immuno-compromised I really shouldn't be moving to several different rooms and wards. Even a layman can tell that this would constitute poor infection control decision making.

title: Helpful friendly
body:
All team pleasant , friendly,  professional. 
On time , very thorough and explained everything x
Easy parking .clean and plenty seating

title: Professional and caring service
body: I was admitted to ward 35 for four nights to be treated for cellulitis. I have nothing but praise for the way in which all the staff performed their duties, sometimes under extremely difficult circumstances. The teams provide an extremely professional service while maintaining a caring attitude to keep all patients as comfortable as possible. Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Excellent Service
body: I got excellent service from the doctors and nurses at this surgery. As I was having some dizzy spells I rang the surgery and got a call back from the doctor the same day. He arranged for me to come in the next day to get an ECG with a nurse and a health check by the doctor. Everything I could need or expect from a GP.

title: Excellent upgrade of telephone appointments
body: Ringing to speak to a doctor has improved beyond reconigiton, instead of having to constantly keep ringing in the hope of getting through. All you do now is ring and you are put into a queue and told your position which then counts down until you speak to the Doctor.

author: cassiopeiaes57
title: Lack of care and understanding
body:
I attended in January for an xray.  
As the appointment was early morning I was unable to have my husband who is my carer with me and have time for him to get our children to school. I decided to attend alone rather than have them be late. As it happened as soon as I arrived I was rushed from registering into the changing room and back out. While waiting for my husband to come for me I realised I had over exerted myself.  
In the rush and the pain and exhaustion and breathing issues I have hit me like a brick. I found myself leaning against a wall in the main forum area across from the info desk with my vision going funny and struggling to breathe. I must’ve been there around 15/20 mins wheezing and shaking all while medical staff walked past. My husband who arrived to pick me up stared worrying as I was ignoring his calls and he couldn’t see me came in and said I was visibly looking awful, he asked at the desk where the wheelchairs were so he could bring one to get me to the car (I was now almost on the floor and hunched over my crutch). The staff member there just pointed and didn’t even ask if everything was ok, which of course if they had looked they would’ve seen! The wheelchairs are completely inaccessible for people arriving, incidentally. My husband spent a good while getting me up and into the chair all while more staff passed by, and got me out of the hospital.  
Several weeks later I had to attend for a related test and after my previous experience there was no way I was going without my carer (husband)! We arrived at the dept and the staff member who was booking us in refused to let my husband in. I explained that he was my career and I’m entitled under the equalities act to have him with me to which they just replied that it was due to Covid. I said that covid doesn’t magic away my rights but without even letting me finish my sentence it was repeated, no, because of Covid. They then said that the dept. would look after me - absolutely not! So I asked if he was refusing my care and they just shrugged. We left the dept. My husband was angry as he knew I needed the test so he spoke to someone at the information desk and there was a member of staff who overheard and called the dept back who said they would allow me to have my carer we just had to wait 5 minutes before going back. When we did go back they did let us into the deptartment - the first staff member was now nowhere to be seen - but they still refused to allow my husband to accompany me to the room which isn’t great as I struggle to remember all the info I’m given. Thankfully the person doing the test related important info about my test to my husband in the waiting room. That wasn’t very great for confidentiality but better than being left. I would be happy to never attend this hospital again as it was so uncaring! I understand trying to restrict numbers but for many of us based on health and experience, having a carer is vital! I can’t believe the person I spoke to was willing to refuse to treat/test me over having my carer support me! Disgusting.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: NHS working at its best.
body: What is classed as a minor operation was not for me and i was extremely nervous. The staff on section 2 had a friendly attitude and were very proficient in their job, they are a credit to Russell's hall hospital. The dept was very clean and ran like clockwork. Thankyou for looking after me.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: I absolutely love this surgery,  I never have any problem with a doctor calling back and the receptionist team are so friendly and helpful.

title: Always very helpful
body:
Attended for a blood test.  Seen on time and had the usual lovely phlebotomist.  
Excellent service many thanks

title: Great Practice
body: I have visited this practice on many occasions, staff are always courteous, helpful, they are truly genuine.  Appointment times are always within minutes of allotted times.

title: No title given
body: All very good, friendly staff and very helpful.  Waiting time all ok.  Everything fully explained

title: How can people be treated like this ?
body: Unfortunately it’s almost impossible to get an appointment or get through on the phone , the service is appalling just read all the negative reviews on various sites , this place does not serve the people of Shepperton and could do a full external review , really really really poor ,

title: Excellent Practice
body: I felt I should leave a review after reading some of the negative ones. I use this surgery personally and through work. I can honestly say they are the most proactive. We always get great support from the GPs and support staff. The GPs who visit are always friendly and we have a positive relationship with the surgery. From a personal point of view, I have always found everyone I have seen to be really helpful and friendly. I always feel comfortable visiting the surgery.

title: Always good
body: I have to attend Orpington Hospital regularly for rehabilitation treatment and my experience has always been very positive. The staff are professional and friendly and they seem well motivated to offer a great service.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Support from Reception
body: Excellent support and help from a member of the Reception staff when I rang to check whether the surgery had received a prescription request for me from Medway Community Health. The Receptionist chased down the e-mail, passed it to a GP for authorising and ensured it then went to Bod Pharma. And rang me back to update  me. Couldn't have asked for better support.

title: Great Service
body: Been seen today, asked if I had a positive experience of which I did, happy to share my experience.  Turned up was seen quite quickly ( waited around 5 minutes), seen by Health care, had my smear. Felt  a bit nervous but was really put at ease.  they do these procedures all day long and don't even bat an eye. I don't know why i was worried at all and should of gone sooner

title: Excellent Practice
body: I've always had excellent service and the staff always do whatever they can to help and sort out, very quickly, any problems that may occur

title: Great treatment
body:
I attended A&E on a busy evening. The waiting room was full. But staff worked well to see people as quickly as possible, every staff member I encountered treated me with care and compassion, I was made to feel at ease and reassured.
They work so hard under such pressure and I think people take it for granted.
I was extremely grateful for the service I recieved.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you Nurse
body: Just wanted to thank the lovely nurse who took my ECG yesterday and put me at ease when I was very nervous. A Romanian lady, she was very thoughtful towards me. I appreciated her kindness as I was dreading the test! Also got my flu and pneumonia jabs all at the same time. Thank you. All of the GPs at Everest Way are superb, too.

title: Perfect
body: I got a very fast call back the e-consult system. Very appreciative to have this system/service as I work full time and find it difficult to make time to call the surgery. Thank you for your understanding.

title: Great practice
body: I was seen very quickly and was able to get another problem sorted. I felt I was listened to properly. With covid, I didn't want to bother anybody so didn't sort my health problems out, I am just now very appreciative that the surgery can help me.

title: Great bedside manner
body: The nurse was awesome made me and my kids feel very relaxed and explained everything which made my kids much more comfortable with the vaccinations

title: Thank you Chigwell Medical centre
body:
For the help that was given to me by their team of staff  when I struggled to get my test results. also Thank you  to the phlebotomist who helped with the queries that I  had and managed to get blood from my shrinking veins. he will be a great G.P with his calm and reassuring manner.
You all went the extra mile in these difficult times.

title: Very good practice
body: Always found them friendly and proficient always answered  any question's  I had very quick at answering phones

title: Fantastic doctors
body: Couldn't be happier. I have had my health issues over last few years and am always happy and relaxed when I leave that I have been given top class help and advice. Have kept me alive. Many thanks

title: Amazing phlebotomist!
body: Normally having blood taken a truly miserable experience as veins are very bad, so what a refreshing change today at Lymington!  Phlebotomist hit gold first time, in and out within a couple of minutes, no pain, zero bruising, happy patient! Thank you so much for such skilled care.

title: Everything you could want!
body: I have just seen one of the senior doctors at Highcroft who was ‘the doctor on call’ today. He was calm, caring and knowledgeable. He listened, sought to gain a deep understanding of my conditions and needs and gave me clear feedback. Most of all, I would like to say how much I appreciated his kindness and patience.

title: Good support and treatment
body: I have been experiencing some health problems over the last 2/3 months and the Dr has been extremely supportive , thorough and taken time with me including follow up phone calls . So a big thank you from me . Having been a patient at the surgery for 44 years it was hard to get used to a new gp , but the experience in the last 2 months has been excellent .

title: Shockingly Poor
body:
I've never felt moved to complain about NHS services, until I moved to Todmorden from Manchester. 
The reception staff at this practice are in urgent need of training on the most basic aspects of interaction with the public. They have been rude and hostile in every conversation I have had with them and I literally dread having to contact them. 
Services are also poor, you can wait for weeks and weeks for follow up appointments that are simply not picked up. I have had to take time off work just to try and get an appointment. I have been reduced to tears on more than one occasion by reception staff when trying to complete the most simple and basic requests. I was literally gas lighted by a member of staff last week and accused of being a liar when I reached out for support in getting urgent medicines. 
I'm actually glad to see that the majority of reviews are making the same points, because i started to think it was just me that had a problem. I, like others, genuinely think that my condition has worsened as a result of being in the 'care' of this practice and have now decided to leave. I moved from a very busy GP practice in Manchester before moving to Todmorden just over a year ago and the comparison between the two surgeries is shocking, they just don't compare.

title: Patients are a nuisance
body: This place needs a shake up. You are greeted with a list of what they can’t or won’t do plus a warning of not to be rude to the staff (it’s their job to be short and abrupt to you). Rang this morning to ask for an appt and, very unusually, after 20 mins (which is good!) got a helpful lady whose hands were completely tied by the daft system they operate. I was told two weeks ago to go for a blood test “then come back and see me”. You would think that if a doctor wants you to return he would diary you an appt - no, you have to call “on the day” as you are presumably telepathic and know when he’s there, which isn’t very often it seems. By the time you get through appts may have gone. You should be able to book a future appt for ongoing or non-urgent treatment. Shouldn’t such an appt be convenient to both parties, isn’t that the idea? Being referred to the website is a joke. No appts currently available, surprise, surprise. I admire their skills and knowledge but the more they earn the fewer GP appts are offered. To see the doctor who sent me for my blood test I now have to wait another four days until he’s in again, then join the eight o’clock scramble in the hope I might get an appt.

title: Non-existent Communication
body: The doctors and reception staff just do not talk to each other - no one knows what anyone is doing and they have no patient care or follow ups. The doctors do not read notes and just throw medication around without even investigating the problems with patients. Do not use this surgery you will not be looked after.

title: Terrible Service
body: Unable to contact by telephone, tried at all hours of the day, constantly engaged, making it impossible to get test results. E-Consult no longer working. Getting an appointment is extremely difficult, receptionist quickly try and send you to A&E when it's not an emergency. Feel very undervalued and let down by what was once a fantastic practice.

title: Appalling 6 hour wait then told to come back in…
body: Mum fractured her ankle, took her to Kings she was there for 6 hours without been seen. She was told there are no doctors treating injuries and she needs to leave and come back at 8am the next day. She had been there since 5pm. Had to take her to Lewisham.

title: Avoid - inefficient
body:
This practice has forgotten that they are there to provide care.

It is literally impossible to see someone in person, a GP, a nurse, anyone. Covid has been here for long enough, so with the right precaution, in person appointment has to come back.  The practice only use an online triage form and not suit for purpose. The end of it is always a message saying somebody will call at any point on a random date 2-4 weeks away, from a random Doctor.
Waiting times are ridiculous. Sometimes it has passed so much time for my initial form and a call with a GP/nurse that my issue has resolved on its own, with me in pain and suffering in the meantime.

Admin staff and receptionist are very inefficient, they forgot so many times to send me over documents about medical plan, and I needed to ring them to remind them more than 4 days in a row in one occasion.

Some of the GP are rude as well. We come to this practice because we are in need of help and not to waste our and your time. Please listen to us. We are not making up symptoms and after waiting more than a year for one of my problem to receive the right attention, I asked to an open referral letter to get a second opinion to go private, and I was not even able to do so. 

There are so many areas this practice needs to improve on. Really inefficient, I am going to change it asap.

title: Cannot get an appointment.
body: I have phoned and sat in a queue multiple times only to be told they cannot help as i am not an emergency! ( I thought 111 and A&E were for that ). Or there are no appointments and need to fill in the online consult form which i have for days on end only to be sent a tex message later that day ,saying there are no appointments. I have also paid during this time to see a podiatrist and he has referred back to my GP for this problem so I have no where else to go now . I have been with this GP practice for 12years I cannot believe how bad it has got!

title: Phlebotomy Department
body:
I visited the Countess Phlebotomy Clinic on 15/03/22 and 7.40am and would like to leave a positive review about my experience. Unfortunatley I have very small veins in both arms making it extremely difficult to take blood and as a result of previous nurses/doctors not recognizing this and attempting to take blood without checking the areas properly I had built up a fear of having my blood taken. There were 2 ladies that were on duty this morning that I felt did everything they could to put me at ease and in general made the experience less nerve wracking. I explained that in the past it has taken nurses 6 or 7 goes before finding any blood and without hesitiation they knew exactly what was best to do and thorughly examined my veins before attempting to take blood. This has made such a difference to my anxiety of getting blood taken going forward and i cannot thank them enough for how patient they were with me. They are a credit to the clinic. 
 I hope these comments are passed onto the two ladies and they are recognized for their kindness.

title: Great treatment but terrible phone services
body:
Came to a and e on thursday 3.3.2022. Was discharged and told to come back on 5.3.22 to have further blood tests and given an appointment for 10am in ambulatory care. The ambulatory care team were great however I was told I would get my results back in 7 days and they would be sent to my gp in southampton. I have phoned my 10 days after my blood test, they informed me they havent received anything so should phone portsmouth ambulatory care department. 
I did this and was simple told by the very unhelpful receptionist "yeah if they havent got them back then that's cuz we havent got them". 
When I explained to the receptionist that the doctor told me it would be a week she replied yeah but they aren't back. 

I am waiting on results back that I'm really worried about. I am aware that things take time but to be told by doctor 7 days and then to phone up 10 days after and still nothing and then to be dealt with by a receptionist who was not very helpful.

title: Quick Response & Easy to contact
body: We moved into the area August 2021 and registered with this practice. So pleased we chose this practice as everybody is friendly and the follow up has been brilliant.  So much easier to contact than our previous practice in Surrey.

title: Withholding my results
body:
I have visited my gp at handsworth medical centre where they referred me for a ecg and a chest X-ray. 
This was over a month ago, I have record a txt saying they have my results but when ever I call up to receive them they are telling me I need to speak to a gp and they will call me back. Then I get no call back.
I have called on many occasions, waited on the phone for over 2 hours and then to be told by the rude reception staff they they is no appointments left and that I have to call back tommrow.
I feel like they are withholding my results from me and this is causing me and my family who are extremely worried anxity.
